Nintendo will discontinue a bunch of online Wii services in June, the company has announced. You'll no longer be able to send and receive messages with other users via the Wii Message Board or access a number of Channel apps. The big switch-off will happen in the UK on 28th June, Nintendo confirmed to Eurogamer. For the chop are the Nintendo Channel, News Channel, Forecast Channel, Everybody Votes Channel and Mii Contest Channel.
